name: Hotel du Vin and Bistro

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: I walked into reception to book a table in the restaurant. What a dump . The furniture looks revolting, i have seen better sofas at the local tip!, Two minutes in the place and i walked out, no way was i taking my guests there.
reviews.title: Reception needs refurbishing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel du Vin Harrogate follows the standard HdV formula, being an old building (in this case a stretch of Victorian terrace) stylishly converted into a modern, hip hotel. The combination of the best of the traditional and modern is a winning formula anywhere and no more so than in the well-to-do town of Harrogate. The hotel would be wonderful were it not let down by a few points of detail and poor service.
reviews.title: Undeniably a nice hotel, but overpriced on current performance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: When we arrived mid afternoon we immediately found ourselves in a queue at the reception desk. Sometimes these things can’t be helped, but the annoying thing was that as soon as we got to the front the receptionist answered a telephone call without even a glance, nod or smile in our direction. The impression was of someone who was not only unprofessional but also extremely rude. Five minutes later and she was still talking on the ‘phone, trying to give directions to someone who’d got lost in Harrogate’s one-way traffic system. Fortunately, the situation was rescued by one of the young foreign staff who spotted the problem and then very politely checked us in and showed us to our room. This young woman was most helpful and had a far better attitude than the more senior local woman we left gassing on the ‘phone.
reviews.title: I Still want to go again despite...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was spacious, kitted out with high quality furniture and stylishly decorated. The bathroom was of the usual HdV standard and supplied with the best toiletries I’ve found at any hotel. One odd thing about the room, though, was the lack of air-con – did they run out of money during the conversion? The room got quite hot at night (at the beginning of October), so I imagine it must have been insufferable at the height of summer. There were two other problems: the CD player did not work and the TV belonged in a museum.
reviews.title: Nice room, poor service but good atmosphere at the bar.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010
reviews.text: We had a good meal in the hotel restaurant – not the best I’ve eaten at an HdV but okay nonetheless. As usual, there was an extensive wine list but the mark-ups on most bottles were excessively steep. The service was variable. The waitresses were absolutely fine but some of the waiters were gauche and awkward and simply not cut out to do the job (this seems to be a common problem at British hotels). To be fair, their task was not made easy by the fact that there were far too many tables crammed into the room.
reviews.title: Tiny room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was special in every respect. The rooms are to die for, the food is amazing and the ambience wonderful. I am a fussy so and so as well but could not fault anything. Will use this chain again.
reviews.title: The WOW factor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel du Vin must be the best chain of hotels in Britain, and the one in Harrogate is the best we've experienced.
reviews.title: an absolutely wonderful hotel

likes.liked: — everything is just perfect. really cool, yet really relaxed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: The rooms are perfectly appointed with incredibly comfortable beds and great bathrooms. The restaurant is excellent and of course the wine list pretty extensive. And breakfast was one of the best we've had in a long time with really good coffee.
reviews.title: Du Vin, One Of Du Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We could live in HDV Harrogate...
reviews.title: Good location, great food but over-priced

likes.disliked: — Reception Staff - so in love with themselves. it hurt!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed at the Hotel Du Vin harrogate on saturday just gone with my girlfriend after reading the reviews, this was a belated birthday (july) present from my girlfriend due to its popularity we had to wait untill the back end of September so i thought it must be good !
reviews.title: A little oasis of pleasure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 2 nights in the Freixenet room on the 2nd floor overloooking the front of the hotel. Check in was fine - parking is a pain if the spaces in front of the hotel are booked. If they aren't you need to get the receptionist to allow you access to a bay - parking is an extra £5 per night
reviews.title: OK, not bad, needs a bit of a clean...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is easy to find and super convenient for exploring teh centre of Harrogate. The building is impressive and attractive. First impressions when entering is that the reception areas need a clean. There is a lot of wood and glass and these areas (including the bar area) are heavily used - but there are finger marks and smears all over the place.
reviews.title: One of our favourite places to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was very spacious with a very large bedroom, huge shower (rainfall) and a free standing bath. Plenty of storage and wardrobe space for a short stay. Mini bar prices very reasonable compared to most hotels. Small TV (old fashioned - not a plasma or flat screen) but it did have a cd player too (plus a free cd of classical music which you could keep)
reviews.title: Disappointed - no attention to detail

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our deal included breaksfast on both mornings - this was a highlight. The bistro is an elegant area with superb service and ambience - the food definitely lived up to expectations.
reviews.title: I wanted to stay another night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would stay again but they do need to address the public areas before it starts to loook shabby.
reviews.title: No wow factor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010
reviews.text: Have just come home from a night in the big loft suite. It was amazing, the bathroom was bigger than my lounge!
reviews.title: Extravagance, perfect for a special occasion

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was tastefully decorated and the bed was so comfy, I didn't want to get out of it.
reviews.title: Comfy bed and excellent food but at a price...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is a bit pricey but it's really good quality. We ate in the restaurant for both dinner and breakfast, and the food was beautiful- compliments to the chef!!
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the HdV Harrogate on a Saturday night in November and had a thoroughly decent stay. Our room was clean, well maintained and spacious with a very comfy kingsize bed and good showerr and bathroom. There was a wedding on in the hotel on the same evening but we weren't disturbed by the celebrations at all and had a great night's sleep - although that may have been more to do with not having kids with us! The food in the hotel is very good - especially the breakfast - however the menu is a bit limited and rather expensive. I can't remember how much we paid but I remember thinking that it was expensive. It is a comfortable hotel with a lot going for it but at the price you pay you're expecting a real treat which never really arrives.
reviews.title: Beautiful bar area but rooms need a bit of maintenance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've stayed in another Hotel Du Vin in Cheltenham, which was excellent, so we thought we'd give this one a go for a one night stay.
reviews.title: ignore the reviews we had a fntastic time......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is fantastic, from the moment my husband and I visited to make enquiries about a wedding we knew it was the place for us. The events organiser Ashley was wonderful, nothing was a problem and she made us feel really special. On the day of our wedding Steve looked after us and we could not have wished for anything better, the professionalism from Steve and all of his staff was amazing. We had a wonderful day and our guests commented on how wonderful the hotel was. I would recommend this hotel 100%.
reviews.title: If you are getting married consider the Hotel Du Vin, its amazing!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On route to the Hotel Du Vin we looked at the Tripadvisor website and was horrified by the stuff we read about this hotel, and when arriving we told our concerns to the Manager Saskia who assured us that we would have none of these problems.
reviews.title: Excellent relaxing time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: All I can say is my Wife and I were very impressed with the level of service with this hotel, the atmosphere, and the loft room in which we stayed. ( especially the twin baths in the bathroom)
reviews.title: Noisy, noisy, noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The massages from Nadine in the Spa were again some of the best we have ever experienced, so to anyone wanting to have a fantastic relaxing romantic weekend in the beautiful town of Harrogate we would recommend the Hotel Du Vin.
reviews.title: Real let down!
What a let down! Avoid!
reviews.text: We LOVE HdV. But sadly this hotel is not up to their regular standards. We stayed in the Wolf Blass room. Alas, HdV have decided to let rooms that sit right below the restaurant and kitchen. It was an incredibly noisy stay. The restaurant has lovely wood flooring.... but there is little insulation between this and your bed. From our room we could hear every foot step and conversation. The noise stopped around 12:30am but started again at around 6 with trolleys and deliveries being dragged across our ceiling. We did not sleep well despite burying our heads under pillows to try to muffle the noise. And unfortunately we were not warned. These rooms should not be let. We raised it with reception and the lovely staff ensured us they would pass it onto management. It sounded like a well rehearsed response as I'm sure every visitor has the same feedback. It's a shame HdV have not fixed this issue as based on past reviews it has been going on for quite a while. The Studley Hotel in Harrogate is a far superior choice. Or HdV in York is brilliant and only 20 miles away. If you insist on staying in HdV Harrogate, make your point by only staying in rooms on the first floor or above. And bring ear plugs.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008
reviews.text: Stayed in the Leyda room for my husbands birthday. The room was fantastic especially the monsoon shower in the bathroom. we had dinner in the bistro which was fantastic. The food was to die for, especially the desserts!! Although its probably best to book before you arrive at the hotel as it was fully booked when we arrived although they did manage to squeeze us into the bistro but at quite a late time to eat (10pm).
reviews.title: Special hotel for special occassions!
lovely place if a little noisy!
reviews.text: There were only two mionor niggles one of which was the car parking- there is limited spaces and when we arrived at 230pm there were none available. We were lucky enough to find a space on the road side which was pay and display but if this hadnt been available then we would have had to walk miles. The meter stops at 6pm so we only had to pay 3hrs which wasnt too bad.

likes.disliked: — the noise and lack of lift

reviews.title: good hotel
reviews.text: The safe in the room didnt work and when we contacted reception, the lady was prompt to arrive at our room to tell us it was a low batterty. We were offered another room however we really liked the room and decided to stay. We would definatley stay at this hotel again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Du Vin for a romantic getaway and werent dissapointed. Warm welcome on arrival, personally shown to your room and shown around.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a lovely room with a fantastic bathroom (freixinet room)that had a free standing bath, the most amazing shower ever and a fab view over the stray to enjoy whilst you were in the bath, lovely! A little notice invited you to take the toiletries home with you which I thought was a lovely touch
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel

likes.liked: — Suite with twin rain showers and double roll top baths, huge 9foot bed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Set opposite the Stray and just a 100 yards from Betty's this hotel is right in the centre of Harrogate and so much better than anything else we have found in the area.
reviews.title: Best in Harrogate by a country mile

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms have everything you need in a practical format and the emphasis is on the right things, comfy bed, huge shower, deep bath, excellent toiletries, decent tea-making kit. It was a hot night (the one this year!) when we stayed so it was a bit stuffy in the room as there is no airconditioning. Otherwise pretty much faultless.
reviews.title: Excellent value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Breakfast is excellent, lovely French style pastries and preserves, yoghurts and cereals and the cooked eggy bacon is terrific, the best of British.
reviews.title: An excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007
reviews.text: We also had dinner in the Bistro one night and it was very good indeed - as evidenced by the full room on a quiet Sunday night. Not cheap, but very good value and you could probably do it for less...if you can resist the tempting options.
reviews.title: Reliably excellent
Great location. Great Hotel
reviews.text: We stayed over the weekend with the hotel's own winter break offer giving half price accommodation for the first night plus a complimentary bottle of champagne (pleased to report it was a full bottle and not a measely half bottle either!).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are looking for a place to stay in Harrogate then look no further and book here!
reviews.title: Perfect Romantic Break in Harrogate

likes.disliked: — ... the room temperature during the night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful room (if a bit hot for the 'other half'. Not sure why it's so warm at the back of the hotel as all sources of heating were switched off), super big / soft beds, huge bath and the shower is a real wow!
reviews.title: Great service, ideal for a romantic break
A poor nights sleep.
reviews.text: Loved the ability to make your own fresh coffee in the morning - no awful coffee sachets and UHT milk here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wish I'd booked the Bistro as it was very popular and other restaurants were a bit thin on the ground in the town, but Hedley's (couple of doors down from Betty's tea rooms) do great food.
reviews.title: Perfect for Romantic Break

likes.liked: — Spacious rooms with all the trimmings
likes.disliked: — No where to plug in the hairdryer near a mirror!

description: Created from a row of eight Georgian-styled houses that have been used as a hotel since the 1930s, Hotel du Vin & Bistro Harrogate features 48 bedrooms and airy loft suites. Located close to the town centre, the Harrogate hotel overlooks The Stray, a magnificent 200-acre common, and offers a billiards room, cellar snug, a Spa du Vin with its extensive range of treatments and alfresco dining in the courtyard during the summer months. Famous for its healing waters, this Victorian spa town oozes cosmopolitan charm, smart streets and quaint mews. Enjoy fabulous shopping, atmospheric cafés, fine restaurants and plenty of green open spaces. Browse antiques and unusual gifts in the stylish Montpellier Quarter or watch the world go by in Betty's Tea Rooms. Hotel du Vin Harrogate provides the perfect combination of luxury and great food and wine within the cultural and visual setting of Harrogate.
